page.title: 09CARSPHAIRN W.R.I.
page.content: Carsphairn Women's Rural Institute was formed in 1935.The annual membership subscription was 2/-.Meetings were arranged for a Thursday evening when there was a full moon to help the ladies to see their way home on foot or bicycle.An annual whist drive and dance were held in November.Membership at its peak was over 50. Meetings are still held each month, with talks, demonstrations, light entertainment, and competitions.There is no longer any necessity to be sure of the full moon, as most members now travel by car! This year, 1985, is the Golden Year, and it is to be celebrated in November with a supper party and entertainment by a Young Farmers' Club.
